header.title: News
header.subtitle: There are {{ articles }} breaking-news headlines today.

rss.label: RSS (Really Simple Syndication)
rss.desc: The data in the article was sourced from the following RSS feed

not-found.title: Error
not-found.desc: An article with the ID {{ id }} could not be found.

article.rights: The copyright of the materials belongs to nyusu.com unless stated otherwise.
article.body: Nyusu.com is a small side-project of mine that aims to test your Japanese reading ability using headlines and excerpts from real Japanese news articles written by and for native Japanese people. A (some-what naive) algorithm produces a difficulty rating for each article based on the ratio of kanji, hiragana, katakana and roman characters, plus the kanji grades. News data is sourced from various RSS feeds and APIs.

title: Most newspapers use only the 2136 characters in the jōyō kanji table.
The Yomimuri Shimbun is the most popular newspaper in Japan.
Today there are said to be 121 daily newspapers that are members of the NSK.

cards.title: CARD VIEW
cards.body: Browse lots of headlines at a glance. Sort by difficulty and filter by source to find the best material for you.

newspaper.title: NEWSPAPER
newspaper.body: View a single headline in detail. Read related text from an excerpt from the article. See detailed information about the difficulty rating and export the contents into an Anki card.

anki.body: Automatically generate Anki cards for headlines and article contents. Click the help button on the left to view instructions on how to configure your desktop client to work with nyusu.com.

github.title: GitHubのプロジェクトを見る

analysis.body: An articles reading difficulty rating is calculated based on the number of the types of characters, their grades and the length of the text.

anki-help.title: Integrating Nyusu with Anki
anki-help.1: Install the Anki desktop application, if you haven't already.
anki-help.anki-website-link: Go to the Anki site to install
anki-help.anki-connect-link: Go to the AnkiConnect page to install
anki-help.about-settings: Anki integration can be configured in the settings drawer accessible in the websites header.
anki-help.test-info: You can use the "{{ button }}" button on the right to add a card with for the article below.
anki-help.add-card-succeeded: Successfully added test card. Check your Anki.
anki-help.add-card-duplicate: The test card already exists in your deck.
anki-help.deck-created: Created deck "{{ deck }}" since it didn't exist already.
anki-help.model-created: Added new model since it did not exist.
anki-help.get-decks-failed: Your Anki decks could not be retrieved.
anki-help.get-decks-succeeded: Successfully connected to Anki desktop. Try adding a card.

solutions.anki-not-installed: Anki may not be installed on your system. Ensure you have followed the prerequisite steps above.
solutions.anki-not-running: Anki may not be running. Check that Anki is open and AnkiConnect is serving on the default port.

rating.description: An articles reading difficulty rating is calculated based on the number of the types of characters, their grades and the length of the text.

translate.description: Translate the article contents to confirm your understanding.

contents.label: Article Contents
contents.default: This article didn't provide any contents, but you can read it directly from the source below.
